summary: This bill, the Financial Inclusion in Banking Act of 2025, amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010. It directs the Office of Community Affairs to identify and address causes and solutions related to under-banked, un-banked, and underserved consumers. The bill mandates research, coordination with other agencies, and the development of financial education strategies.  It requires the Office to report to Congress every two years, outlining barriers and making recommendations to improve consumer participation in the banking system.
